pokedex_entries.black: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
pokedex_entries.white: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When its body dries out, it weakens. So it wraps a membrane around itself for protection while it spits poison.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.
pokedex_entries.sword: It moves with blinding speed and lobs poison at foes. Featuring Accelgor as a main character is a surefire way to make a movie or comic popular.
pokedex_entries.shield: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.

pokedex_entries.black: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.
pokedex_entries.white: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Floating in the open sea is how they live. When they find a wounded Pokémon, they embrace it and bring it to shore.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
pokedex_entries.sun: It uses its special mucus to close the wounds of injured Pokémon. The reason for this behavior remains unknown.
pokedex_entries.moon: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Fishermen take them along on long voyages, because if you have an Alomomola with you, there’ll be no need for a doctor or medicine.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.
pokedex_entries.violet: They float upon the open sea. Many water Pokémon gather in the area around Alomomola.

pokedex_entries.black: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
pokedex_entries.white: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They show off their Poké Ball caps to lure prey, but very few Pokémon are fooled by this.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon puffs poisonous spores at its foes. If the spores aren’t washed off quickly, they’ll grow into mushrooms wherever they land.
pokedex_entries.shield: Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have been dropped on the ground.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Be wary of the poisonous spores it releases. Mushrooms resembling Amoonguss’s caps will grow out of anywhere the spores touch.
pokedex_entries.violet: Amoonguss mimics Poké Balls. It is not yet clear whether this mimicry is effective against other Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.black: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
pokedex_entries.white: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It was revived from an ancient fossil. Not able to fly, it lived in treetops and hopped from one branch to another.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Revived from a fossil, this Pokémon is thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.
pokedex_entries.sun: It is the ancestor of all bird Pokémon. Archen itself could not actually fly but moved by hopping from treetop to treetop.
pokedex_entries.moon: To all appearances flightless, it was able to glide down from tall treetops to snag its prey.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Once thought to be the ancestor of all bird Pokémon, some of the latest research suggests that may not be the case.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can’t yet fly.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. As research suggested, Archen is unable to fly. But it’s very good at jumping.
pokedex_entries.shield: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.black: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
pokedex_entries.white: It runs better than it flies. It catches prey by running at speeds comparable to those of an automobile.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky by running at a speed of 25 mph.
pokedex_entries.sun: Although apparently able to fly, they tended to run along the ground, averaging speeds of roughly 25 mph.
pokedex_entries.moon: They hunted in flocks. When one Archeops had the prey cornered, another would swoop on it.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This ancient Pokémon’s plumage is delicate, so if anyone other than an experienced professional tries to restore it, they will fail.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak, so it needs a long runway in order to take off.
pokedex_entries.sword: It needs a running start to take off. If Archeops wants to fly, it first needs to run nearly 25 mph, building speed over a course of about 2.5 miles.
pokedex_entries.shield: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.

pokedex_entries.black: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
pokedex_entries.white: Its auditory sense is astounding. It has a radarlike ability to understand its surroundings through slight sounds.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.
pokedex_entries.sword: Audino’s sense of hearing is superb. Not even a pebble rolling along over a mile away will escape Audino’s ears.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’ feelings and physical conditions.

pokedex_entries.black: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
pokedex_entries.white: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Its large tusks have a tendency to break, but each time they grow back, they grow in harder and sturdier.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.
pokedex_entries.sword: These Pokémon nest in the ground and use their tusks to crush hard berries. Crushing berries is also how they test each other’s strength.
pokedex_entries.shield: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon lives in nests that are made in the ground. People in ancient times used its tusks as cooking knives.
pokedex_entries.violet: If you see peculiar teeth marks on boulders or trees, it means an Axew is likely living nearby.

pokedex_entries.black: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.
pokedex_entries.white: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other’s school.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Red- and blue-striped Basculin are very violent and always fighting. They are also remarkably tasty.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other’s school.

pokedex_entries.black: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.
pokedex_entries.white: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They love the cold seas of the north. They create pathways across the ocean waters by freezing their own breath.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.
pokedex_entries.sword: It swims through frigid seas, searching for prey. From its frozen breath, it forms icy fangs that are harder than steel.
pokedex_entries.shield: It swims energetically through frigid seas. When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater with its breath so it can rest on the ice.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It is a ferocious, carnivorous Pokémon. Once it captures its prey, it will breathe cold air onto the prey to freeze and preserve it.
pokedex_entries.violet: Feared as the Snow-White Demon in northern lands, Beartic uses its frosty claws and fangs to attack prey.

pokedex_entries.black: It can manipulate an opponent’s memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.
pokedex_entries.white: It uses psychic power to control an opponent’s brain and tamper with its memories.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven’t been decoded.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three fingers, but those patterns haven’t been decoded.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It uses psychic power to control an opponent’s brain and tamper with its memories.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: With its psychic powers, it rewrites its opponents’ memories. You, too, may have already had your memories rewritten.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It has strong psychic powers. Using its fingers that flash three different colors, it controls its opponents and rewrites their memories.
pokedex_entries.sword: Whenever a Beheeyem visits a farm, a Dubwool mysteriously disappears.
pokedex_entries.shield: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.

pokedex_entries.black: It leads a group of Pawniard. It battles to become the boss, but will be driven from the group if it loses.
pokedex_entries.white: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: This pitiless Pokémon commands a group of Pawniard to hound prey into immobility. It then moves in to finish the prey off.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: No matter how strong the Bisharp, it’s said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It leads a group of Pawniard. Bisharp doesn’t even change its expression when it deals the finishing blow to an opponent.
pokedex_entries.sword: It’s accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.
pokedex_entries.shield: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon commands a group of several Pawniard. Groups that are defeated in territorial disputes are absorbed by the winning side.
pokedex_entries.violet: Bisharp mercilessly cuts its opponents to pieces with the sharp blades covering its body. It will do anything to win.

pokedex_entries.black: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.
pokedex_entries.white: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

pokedex_entries.black: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.
pokedex_entries.white: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Because its energy was too great to be contained, the energy leaked and formed orange crystals.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.
pokedex_entries.sun: Its orange crystal is a mass of energy. Just one crystal fragment would provide enough fuel for a hundred dump trucks.
pokedex_entries.moon: It explores caves in search of underground water. It’s not comfortable around water, so this Pokémon takes great care in lapping it up.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The energy overflowing from its body has turned into orange crystals that are hard enough to smash diamonds.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful energy. They’re valuable, so Boldore is sometimes targeted for them.
pokedex_entries.sword: If you see its orange crystals start to glow, be wary. It’s about to fire off bursts of energy.
pokedex_entries.shield: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.

pokedex_entries.black: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
pokedex_entries.white: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: They are known to charge so wildly that if a train were to enter their territory, they would send it flying.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They charge wildly and headbutt everything. Their headbutts have enough destructive force to derail a train.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.
pokedex_entries.sword: These Pokémon can crush a car with no more than a headbutt. Bouffalant with more hair on their heads hold higher positions within the herd.
pokedex_entries.shield: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

pokedex_entries.black: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.
pokedex_entries.white: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.
pokedex_entries.sun: With its brave disposition, it fears nothing—not even death. Ancient Alolan people respected it, referring to it as “the hero of the sky.”
pokedex_entries.moon: It’s thought that people disturbed their habitats in the past, so Braviary banded together to fight back.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The more scars it has on its front, the more heroic it’s considered to be. Those with many scars on their back are mocked by the flock.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Known as “the hero of the skies,” this Pokémon is so proud and so brave that it will never retreat, even when it’s injured.
pokedex_entries.sword: Known for its bravery and pride, this majestic Pokémon is often seen as a motif for various kinds of emblems.
pokedex_entries.shield: Because this Pokémon is hotheaded and belligerent, it’s Corviknight that’s taken the role of transportation in Galar.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.
pokedex_entries.violet: For the sake of its friends, this brave warrior of the sky will not stop battling, even if injured.

pokedex_entries.black: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
pokedex_entries.white: Incredible jaw strength enables them to chew up steel beams and rocks along with their prey.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its developed front appendages and chew it up, shell or bones and all.
pokedex_entries.sun: It constructed its sturdy shell by crunching and swallowing the hard shells or bones of its prey.
pokedex_entries.moon: Active both on land and in the sea, this Pokémon drags its land-based prey into the water to finish it off.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.
pokedex_entries.sword: Carracosta completely devours its prey—bones, shells, and all. Because of this, Carracosta’s own shell grows thick and sturdy.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.

pokedex_entries.black: It absorbs a spirit, which it then burns. By waving the flames on its arms, it puts its foes into a hypnotic trance.
pokedex_entries.white: Being consumed in Chandelure’s flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Being consumed in Chandelure’s flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon haunts dilapidated mansions. It sways its arms to hypnotize opponents with the ominous dancing of its flames.
pokedex_entries.shield: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.

pokedex_entries.black: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.
pokedex_entries.white: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Their white fur feels amazing to touch. Their fur repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Cinccino’s body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The white parts of its coat are covered in an oil secreted from its body, so this Pokémon can slide right away from its enemies’ attacks.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won’t tolerate even a speck of the stuff.
pokedex_entries.shield: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.

pokedex_entries.black: This legendary Pokémon battled against humans to protect Pokémon. Its personality is calm and composed.
pokedex_entries.white: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon appears in a legend alongside Terrakion and Virizion, fighting against humans in defense of the Unova region’s Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.shield: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.

pokedex_entries.black: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
pokedex_entries.white: They pretend to be elaborate coffins to teach lessons to grave robbers. Their bodies are covered in pure gold.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon has a body of sparkling gold. People say it no longer remembers that it was once human.
pokedex_entries.shield: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

pokedex_entries.black: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
pokedex_entries.white: They use concrete pillars as walking canes. They know moves that enable them to swing the pillars freely in battle.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.
pokedex_entries.sword: Concrete mixed by Conkeldurr is much more durable than normal concrete, even when the compositions of the two materials are the same.
pokedex_entries.shield: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.

pokedex_entries.black: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
pokedex_entries.white: They go wherever the wind takes them. On rainy days, their bodies are heavier, so they take shelter beneath big trees.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.
pokedex_entries.sun: When it finds others of its kind, they all stick together. When enough of them have collected, the mass resembles a cumulonimbus cloud.
pokedex_entries.moon: Pillows and beds stuffed with cotton exhaled by Cottonee are soft and puffy, light and airy— altogether top quality.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can’t move as well.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When attacked, it expels cotton from its body to create a diversion. The cotton it loses grows back in quickly.
pokedex_entries.sword: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.
pokedex_entries.shield: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.

pokedex_entries.black: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
pokedex_entries.white: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It possesses legs of enormous strength, enabling it to carry heavy slabs for many days, even when crossing arid land.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.
pokedex_entries.sword: This highly territorial Pokémon prefers dry climates. It won’t come out of its boulder on rainy days.
pokedex_entries.shield: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.

pokedex_entries.black: When its body temperature goes up, it turns into steam and vanishes. When its temperature lowers, it returns to ice.
pokedex_entries.white: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148° F.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.sword: With its icy chains, Cryogonal freezes those it encounters. It then takes its victims away to somewhere unknown.
pokedex_entries.shield: When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never seen during summer.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Cryogonal appear during cold seasons. It is said that people and Pokémon who die on snowy mountains are reborn into these Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.violet: Cryogonal uses its chains of ice to constrict its opponents and then flash-freezes them where they stand.

pokedex_entries.black: When it is not feeling well, its mucus gets watery and the power of its Ice-type moves decreases.
pokedex_entries.white: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.
pokedex_entries.sword: When this Pokémon is in good health, its snot becomes thicker and stickier. It will smear its snot on anyone it doesn’t like.
pokedex_entries.shield: It sniffles before performing a move, using its frosty snot to provide an icy element to any move that needs it.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Many of this species can be found along the shorelines of cold regions. If a Cubchoo lacks dangling snot, there’s a chance it is sick.
pokedex_entries.violet: When Cubchoo starts sneezing, watch out! If it spatters you with its frosty snot, you’ll get frostbite.

pokedex_entries.black: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.
pokedex_entries.white: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue. Then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When one is injured in a fierce battle, it hardens into a stone-like form. Then it meditates and sharpens its mind.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

pokedex_entries.black: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.
pokedex_entries.white: Darumaka’s droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100° F.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Darumaka’s droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokedex_entries.sword: It derives its power from fire burning inside its body. If the fire dwindles, this Pokémon will immediately fall asleep.
pokedex_entries.shield: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.

pokedex_entries.black: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.
pokedex_entries.white: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

pokedex_entries.black: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.
pokedex_entries.white: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Lacking sight, it’s unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.
pokedex_entries.sword: When it encounters something, its first urge is usually to bite it. If it likes what it tastes, it will commit the associated scent to memory.
pokedex_entries.shield: Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It can’t see, so its first approach to examining things is to bite them. You will be covered in wounds until a Deino warms up to you.
pokedex_entries.violet: It nests deep inside a cave. Food there is scarce, so Deino will sink its teeth into anything that moves and attempt to eat it.

pokedex_entries.black: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
pokedex_entries.white: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.
pokedex_entries.legends:_arceus: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.

pokedex_entries.black: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.
pokedex_entries.white: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It makes its way swiftly through the soil by putting both claws together and rotating at high speed.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.
pokedex_entries.sword: It brings its claws together and whirls around at high speed before rushing toward its prey.
pokedex_entries.shield: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

pokedex_entries.black: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
pokedex_entries.white: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It runs through the narrow tunnels formed by Excadrill and Onix. It uses its sharp claws to catch prey.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The red skin on its face is harder than rock. In narrow caves, it squares off against its enemies and charges face-first right into them.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It infiltrates tunnels that Pokémon like Diglett and Dugtrio have dug and quietly waits for prey to pass through.
pokedex_entries.sword: Druddigon lives in caves, but it never skips sunbathing—it won’t be able to move if its body gets too cold.
pokedex_entries.shield: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

pokedex_entries.black: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.
pokedex_entries.white: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When attacked, it uses its feathers to splash water, escaping under cover of the spray.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

pokedex_entries.black: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
pokedex_entries.white: When their brains, now divided in two, are thinking the same thoughts, these Pokémon exhibit their maximum power.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its psychic power can supposedly cover a range of more than half a mile—but only if its two brains can agree with each other.
pokedex_entries.shield: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.

pokedex_entries.black: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
pokedex_entries.white: Durant dig nests in mountains. They build their complicated, interconnected tunnels into mazes.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Individuals each play different roles in driving Heatmor, their natural predator, away from their colony.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.
pokedex_entries.sword: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.
pokedex_entries.shield: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

pokedex_entries.black: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.white: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It makes a hole in a suitable rock. If that rock breaks, the Pokémon remains agitated until it locates a replacement.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.
pokedex_entries.sword: When it finds a stone appealing, it creates a hole inside it and uses it as its home. This Pokémon is the natural enemy of Roggenrola and Rolycoly.
pokedex_entries.shield: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

pokedex_entries.black: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
pokedex_entries.white: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It wraps itself around its prey and paralyzes it with electricity from the round spots on its sides. Then it chomps.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: They coil around foes and shock them with electricity-generating organs that seem simply to be circular patterns.
pokedex_entries.violet: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

pokedex_entries.black: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
pokedex_entries.white: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: With their sucker mouths, they suck in prey. Then they use their fangs to shock the prey with electricity.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
pokedex_entries.violet: It latches on to prey with its sucker mouth, sinking in its fangs and shocking the prey with powerful electricity.

pokedex_entries.black: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.
pokedex_entries.white: This Pokémon had never been seen until it appeared from far in the desert 50 years ago.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent’s brain, causing unendurable headaches.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It controls tremendous psychic power. Most reports of alien sightings are actually just people mistaking Elgyem for an alien.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: This Pokémon is shrouded in mystery. It’s said to have appeared from a UFO that fell from the sky about 50 years ago.
pokedex_entries.sword: If this Pokémon stands near a TV, strange scenery will appear on the screen. That scenery is said to be from its home.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.

pokedex_entries.black: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
pokedex_entries.white: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: A flaring beard of fire is proof that it is fired up. It is adept at using many different moves.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

pokedex_entries.black: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
pokedex_entries.white: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It glides on its outstretched membrane while shocking foes with the electricity stored in the pouches on its cheeks.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.
pokedex_entries.sun: It glides using its cape-like membrane. Electrical energy scatters from it, shocking its friends and foes alike.
pokedex_entries.moon: It grills berries and bug Pokémon with electric shocks and makes a meal of them. It usually nests in the holes gouged in trees by Pikipek.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: They store up electricity to fly through the air. When thunder cracks at night, sometimes there are almost enough of them to blot out the sky.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That’s why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.
pokedex_entries.sword: As Emolga flutters through the air, it crackles with electricity. This Pokémon is cute, but it can cause a lot of trouble.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.

pokedex_entries.black: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.
pokedex_entries.white: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.
pokedex_entries.sword: They use shells they’ve stolen from Shelmet to arm and protect themselves. They’re very popular Pokémon in the Galar region.
pokedex_entries.shield: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.

pokedex_entries.black: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
pokedex_entries.white: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
pokedex_entries.sword: It’s not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill’s rampant digging.
pokedex_entries.shield: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

pokedex_entries.black: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
pokedex_entries.white: They stick their spikes into cave walls and absorb the minerals they find in the rock.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.
pokedex_entries.sword: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn’t very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.
pokedex_entries.shield: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.

pokedex_entries.black: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.
pokedex_entries.white: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: By swinging around its three spiky feelers and shooting spikes, it can obliterate an opponent.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.
pokedex_entries.shield: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.

pokedex_entries.black: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
pokedex_entries.white: For some reason, this Pokémon resembles a Poké Ball. They release poison spores to repel those who try to catch them.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball then releases poison spores.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.
pokedex_entries.sword: No one knows what the Poké Ball–like pattern on Foongus means or why Foongus has it.
pokedex_entries.shield: The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: There is a theory that the developer of the modern-day Poké Ball really liked Foongus, but this has not been confirmed.
pokedex_entries.violet: This Pokémon prefers damp places. It spurts out poison spores to repel approaching enemies.

pokedex_entries.black: Since a broken tusk will not grow back, they diligently sharpen their tusks on river rocks after they’ve been fighting.
pokedex_entries.white: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Their tusks can shatter rocks. Territory battles between Fraxure can be intensely violent.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.
pokedex_entries.sword: After battle, this Pokémon carefully sharpens its tusks on river rocks. It needs to take care of its tusks—if one breaks, it will never grow back.
pokedex_entries.shield: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Because its tusks don’t grow back once they break, this Pokémon apparently won’t use them unless truly necessary.
pokedex_entries.violet: Fraxure uses its thick tusks to neatly cut prey into two portions—one to eat now and one to save for later.

pokedex_entries.black: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.
pokedex_entries.white: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It wraps its veillike arms and legs around prey swimming by and drags them down to the depths of the ocean.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Using the invisible poison spikes on its veillike arms and legs, it paralyzes its enemies and causes them to drown.

pokedex_entries.black: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
pokedex_entries.white: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It creates barriers from electrified silk that stun foes. This works as a weapon as well as a defense.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They employ an electrically charged web to trap their prey. While it is immobilized by shock, they leisurely consume it.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.
pokedex_entries.sword: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.
pokedex_entries.shield: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.

pokedex_entries.black: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.white: They absorb garbage and make it part of their bodies. They shoot a poisonous liquid from their right-hand fingertips.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison gases and liquids inside their bodies.
pokedex_entries.sun: Beware the poisonous liquid it shoots from its right arm. If even a little of it gets on you, you’ll experience the effects of the unidentified toxin.
pokedex_entries.moon: For a time, their numbers increased explosively in Alola. Since the arrival of Grimer, their population has decreased dramatically.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It locks opponents in place with its left hand, immobilizing them by entirely dousing their bodies with poisonous liquid.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Some say the reason Garbodor in Alola are a little stronger than their counterparts elsewhere is the presence of Muk, their natural enemy.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison inside its body. The main component of the poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.
pokedex_entries.shield: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

pokedex_entries.black: Over 300 million years ago, it was feared as the strongest of hunters. It has been modified by Team Plasma.
pokedex_entries.white: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

pokedex_entries.black: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
pokedex_entries.white: The solar energy absorbed by its body’s orange crystals is magnified internally and fired from its mouth.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The solar rays it absorbs are processed in its energy core and fired as a ball of light.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.
pokedex_entries.sun: The blasts of energy it makes from sunbeams have terrifying power. However, it’s not able to fire its blasts at night or on rainy days.
pokedex_entries.moon: Known for its hefty horsepower, this Pokémon is a popular partner for construction workers.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When it fires off energy with all its might, the power creates countless fissures on its body.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out energy. It’s usually lurking deep beneath the surface.
pokedex_entries.sword: This hardy Pokémon can often be found on construction sites and in mines, working alongside people and Copperajah.
pokedex_entries.shield: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.

pokedex_entries.black: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
pokedex_entries.white: These Pokémon are thought to have been created by the science of an ancient and mysterious civilization.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It’s been active for thousands of years.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The energy that burns inside it enables it to move, but no one has yet been able to identify this energy.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It’s been active for thousands of years.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Its movements are powered by a mysterious energy. It has continued to move since ancient times, so its power may soon run out.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Although ancient people apparently built it by working with clay, the source of its energy is unclear.
pokedex_entries.sword: They were sculpted from clay in ancient times. No one knows why, but some of them are driven to continually line up boulders.
pokedex_entries.shield: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

pokedex_entries.black: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
pokedex_entries.white: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Golurk were created to protect people and Pokémon. They run on a mysterious energy.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It is said that Golurk were ordered to protect people and Pokémon by the ancient people who made them.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Some say that ancient people invented Golurk to serve as a laborer. It follows its master’s orders faithfully.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately, turning the whole town around it into a mountain of rubble.
pokedex_entries.sword: Artillery platforms built into the walls of ancient castles served as perches from which Golurk could fire energy beams.
pokedex_entries.shield: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.

pokedex_entries.black: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.white: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It stares intently at everything. It can become so obsessed with watching that it doesn’t notice attacks.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.
pokedex_entries.sword: Though they’re still only babies, there’s psychic power stored in their ribbonlike feelers, and sometimes they use that power to fight.
pokedex_entries.shield: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it’s speaking to something only it can see.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon is normally very innocent. When it is staring at something invisible, it is unblinking and utterly silent.
pokedex_entries.violet: Beware of touching the ribbon-shaped feelers that control its psychic power. Gothita will begin bawling if you do.

pokedex_entries.black: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
pokedex_entries.white: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It can see the future from the movement of the stars. When it learns its Trainer’s life span, it cries in sadness.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers’ life spans.
pokedex_entries.sword: It has tremendous psychic power, but it dislikes conflict. It’s also able to predict the future based on the movement of the stars.
pokedex_entries.shield: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Gothitelle unleashes psychic energy and shows opponents dreams of the universe’s end. These dreams are apparently ethereal and beautiful.
pokedex_entries.violet: It gazes at the stars to predict the future. It acts somewhat detached because it has seen the end of all existence.

pokedex_entries.black: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.
pokedex_entries.white: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Starlight is the source of their power. At night, they mark star positions by using psychic power to float stones.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.
pokedex_entries.sword: It’s said that when stars shine in the night sky, this Pokémon will spirit away sleeping children. Some call it the Witch of Punishment.
pokedex_entries.shield: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon will hypnotize children to put them to sleep before carrying them away. Be wary of nights when the starlight is bright.
pokedex_entries.violet: Using its psychic power, it arranges pebbles to form the shapes of constellations. Some people believe this Pokémon came from outer space.

pokedex_entries.black: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
pokedex_entries.white: They strengthen their bodies by carrying steel beams. They show off their big muscles to their friends.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: With strengthened bodies, they skillfully wield steel beams to take down buildings.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.
pokedex_entries.sword: It shows off its muscles to Machoke and other Gurdurr. If it fails to measure up to the other Pokémon, it lies low for a little while.
pokedex_entries.shield: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.

pokedex_entries.black: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
pokedex_entries.white: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Its tusks are incredibly destructive. They can easily slice through a thick, sturdy steel column every time.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its resilient tusks are its pride and joy. It licks up dirt to take in the minerals it needs to keep its tusks in top condition.
pokedex_entries.shield: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: This Pokémon nests in caves and abandoned mines. It is docile, but it will become incredibly angry if its tusks are touched, so beware.
pokedex_entries.violet: It overwhelms enemies with its prized tusks, which are sharp enough to cut through a metal transmission tower in one strike.

pokedex_entries.black: It breathes through a hole in its tail while it burns with an internal fire. Durant is its prey.
pokedex_entries.white: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant’s steel bodies and consume their insides.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Using their very hot, flame-covered tongues, they burn through Durant’s steel bodies and consume their insides.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.
pokedex_entries.sword: There’s a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.
pokedex_entries.shield: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

pokedex_entries.black: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
pokedex_entries.white: It loyally follows its Trainer’s orders. For ages, they have helped Trainers raise Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: This very loyal Pokémon helps Trainers, and it also takes care of other Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.
pokedex_entries.sun: Its dense black fur grows continuously. The high cost of keeping its hard fur properly groomed makes this a troublesome Pokémon to train.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon obeys its master’s orders faithfully. However, it refuses to listen to anything said by a person it doesn’t respect.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: The longer its black fur grows, the harder and more impervious it gets. Claws and fangs can’t easily penetrate it.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It has been living with people for so long that portrayals of it can be found on the walls of caves from long, long ago.
pokedex_entries.sword: Herdier is a very smart and friendly Pokémon. So much so that there’s a theory that Herdier was the first Pokémon to partner with people.
pokedex_entries.shield: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.

pokedex_entries.black: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.
pokedex_entries.white: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!
pokedex_entries.sword: There are a slew of stories about villages that were destroyed by Hydreigon. It bites anything that moves.
pokedex_entries.shield: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their target goes down.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Only the central head has a brain. It is very intelligent, but it thinks only of destruction.
pokedex_entries.violet: It’s said that Hydreigon grew ferocious because people in times long past loathed it, considering it to be evil incarnate and attacking it relentlessly.

pokedex_entries.black: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
pokedex_entries.white: They propel themselves by expelling absorbed seawater from their bodies. Their favorite food is life energy.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Its body is mostly seawater. It’s said there’s a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Its body is mostly seawater. It’s said there’s a castle of ships Jellicent have sunk on the seafloor.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Jellicent is always hanging around fancy cruise ships and tankers, hoping to drag away its prey.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Fishermen are terrified of Jellicent. It’s rumored to drag them into the sea and steal their lives away.

pokedex_entries.black: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.
pokedex_entries.white: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Since it can’t generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Since it can’t generate its own electricity, it sticks onto large-bodied Pokémon and absorbs static electricity.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.
pokedex_entries.sword: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It’s soaking up static electricity because it can’t produce a charge on its own.
pokedex_entries.shield: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.

pokedex_entries.black: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.white: When they feel threatened, they spit an acidic liquid to drive attackers away. This Pokémon targets Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.
pokedex_entries.sword: Its strange physiology reacts to electrical energy in interesting ways. The presence of a Shelmet will cause this Pokémon to evolve.
pokedex_entries.shield: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.

pokedex_entries.black: By blasting water from its hooves, it can glide across water. It excels at using leg moves while battling.
pokedex_entries.white: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

pokedex_entries.black: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
pokedex_entries.white: Spinning minigears are rotated at high speed and repeatedly fired away. It is dangerous if the gears don’t return.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: By changing the direction in which it rotates, it communicates its feelings to others. When angry, it rotates faster.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn’t return, it will die.
pokedex_entries.sword: When Klang goes all out, the minigear links up perfectly with the outer part of the big gear, and this Pokémon’s rotation speed increases sharply.
pokedex_entries.shield: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.

pokedex_entries.black: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
pokedex_entries.white: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Two bodies comprise a fixed pair. They spin around each other to generate energy.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
pokedex_entries.sword: The two minigears that compose this Pokémon are closer than twins. They mesh well only with each other.
pokedex_entries.shield: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.

pokedex_entries.black: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
pokedex_entries.white: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: The minigear spins at high speed. Then the energy from the red core charges the minigear to make it ready to fire.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The gear with the red core is rotated at high speed for a rapid energy charge.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.
pokedex_entries.sword: From its spikes, it launches powerful blasts of electricity. Its red core contains an enormous amount of energy.
pokedex_entries.shield: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.

pokedex_entries.black: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
pokedex_entries.white: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.
pokedex_entries.sun: They move in groups of a few individuals. A female is often the leader of the group, and the males will gather food.
pokedex_entries.moon: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: Krokorok really hates it when its body gets cold. On nights when the temperature drops, it digs deep into the desert sands.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.
pokedex_entries.sword: Krokorok has specialized eyes that enable it to see in the dark. This ability lets Krokorok hunt in the dead of night without getting lost.
pokedex_entries.shield: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Protected by thin membranes, their eyes can see even in the dead of night. They live in groups of a few individuals.
pokedex_entries.violet: Thanks to the special membrane covering its eyes, it can see its surroundings clearly, even in the middle of the night.

pokedex_entries.black: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
pokedex_entries.white: It can expand the focus of its eyes, enabling it to see objects in the far distance as if it were using binoculars.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Very violent Pokémon, they try to clamp down on anything that moves in front of their eyes.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.
pokedex_entries.sun: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
pokedex_entries.moon: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: When it spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it were water, then jumps out and chomps them.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sands. Krookodile’s mighty jaws can bite through heavy plates of iron with almost no effort at all.
pokedex_entries.shield: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: After clamping down with its powerful jaws, it twists its body around to rip its prey in half.
pokedex_entries.violet: Its unique faculty of sight can detect small prey more than 30 miles away, even in the midst of a sandstorm.
