pokedex_entries.sun: It rides on the wind and slips into people’s homes. After it has turned a room into a cotton-filled mess, it giggles to itself and takes off.
pokedex_entries.moon: This Pokémon appears, riding upon the wind. But if the wind gusts up, it’ll blow the cotton on this Pokémon’s head clean off.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This nuisance sneaks into people’s homes, where it hides important things and scatters cotton all over the place.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: Whimsicott doesn’t live in a fixed location. It floats around on whirling winds, appearing all over the place to perform its mischief.
pokedex_entries.sword: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it’ll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.
pokedex_entries.shield: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

pokedex_entries.black: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
pokedex_entries.white: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Storing energy for evolution, it sits. But, when predators approach, it moves to stab them with poison spikes.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon spins itself rapidly and charges into its opponents. Its top speed is just over 60 mph.
pokedex_entries.shield: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.

pokedex_entries.black: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.white: Suction from its nostrils enables it to stick to cave walls during sleep. It leaves a heart-shaped mark behind.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.
pokedex_entries.sword: While inside a cave, if you look up and see lots of heart-shaped marks lining the walls, it’s evidence that Woobat live there.
pokedex_entries.shield: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.black: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
pokedex_entries.white: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves in past ages. Each retains memories of its former life.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: These Pokémon arose from the spirits of people interred in graves. Each retains memories of its former life.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.
pokedex_entries.sword: It wanders through ruins by night, carrying a mask that’s said to have been the face it had when it was still human.
pokedex_entries.shield: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.

pokedex_entries.black: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
pokedex_entries.white: This ill-tempered Pokémon is dangerous because when it’s angry, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

pokedex_entries.black: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
pokedex_entries.white: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.
pokedex_entries.sword: When the interior part of its tail spins like a motor, Zekrom can generate many bolts of lightning to blast its surroundings.
pokedex_entries.shield: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.

pokedex_entries.black: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
pokedex_entries.white: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: It doesn’t just transform itself—it also has the power to make hundreds of people see its illusions.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: If it thinks humans are going to discover its den, Zoroark shows them visions that make them wander around in the woods.
pokedex_entries.sword: This Pokémon cares deeply about others of its kind, and it will conjure terrifying illusions to keep its den and pack safe.
pokedex_entries.shield: Seeking to ease the burden of their solitude, lonely Trainers tell Zoroark to show illusions to them.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: Stories say those who tried to catch Zoroark were trapped in an illusion and punished.
pokedex_entries.violet: Each has the ability to fool a large group of people simultaneously. They protect their lair with illusory scenery.

pokedex_entries.black: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
pokedex_entries.white: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: It changes so it looks just like its foe, tricks it, and then uses that opportunity to flee.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.
pokedex_entries.ultra_sun: This Pokémon has a cowardly disposition, so when it’s not around friends, it basically always stays transformed as something else.
pokedex_entries.ultra_moon: If a normally talkative child suddenly stops talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.
pokedex_entries.sword: Zorua is a timid Pokémon. This disposition seems to be what led to the development of Zorua’s ability to take on the forms of other creatures.
pokedex_entries.shield: Zorua sometimes transforms into a person and goes into cities to search for food. When Zorua does this, it usually takes on the form of a child.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.
pokedex_entries.violet: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their true identities by transforming into people and Pokémon.

pokedex_entries.black: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
pokedex_entries.white: Since their two heads do not get along and compete with each other for food, they always eat too much.
pokedex_entries.black_2white_2: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
pokedex_entries.xomega_ruby: The two heads do not get along. Whichever head eats more than the other gets to be the leader.
pokedex_entries.yalpha_sapphire: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.
pokedex_entries.sword: While hunting for prey, Zweilous wanders its territory, its two heads often bickering over which way to go.
pokedex_entries.shield: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.
pokedex_entries.scarlet: The two heads do not get along at all. If you don’t give each head the same amount of attention, they’ll begin fighting out of jealousy.
pokedex_entries.violet: The two heads have different likes and dislikes. Because the heads fight with each other, Zweilous gets stronger without needing to rely on others.
